summary: Build an app (UI based on a provided image) that lets the user enter marks and automatically calculates results, keeping the output format identical to the image.
architectural_notes: Print CSS must enforce A4 landscape and scale/fit content to one page (avoid page breaks; use @page size: A4 landscape and page-break controls).

To ensure the entire report card fits on a single A4 landscape page, adjust print-specific typography (e.g., smaller font sizes/line-heights) and/or apply a print-only scale transform in CSS while preserving the table structure.
known_issues: UI is missing the School Name and Student Name fields/columns shown in the reference layout.
Subject rows/marks are not editable as required (inputs not editable).
School Name should be fixed at the top of the layout (header positioning not matching the reference).
Duplicate School Name column/field appears twice in the layout; needs one removed.

existing_features.title: Recreate the report-card/table layout shown in the uploaded image as the main screen of the app, keeping headings, sections, and column structure visually consistent with the image.

Provide editable inputs for entering marks per subject for: 1st Unit Test, 2nd Unit Test, Half Yearly (out of 100), and Annual Exam (out of 100). The rest of the columns must auto-calculate and render in-place in the same row.

Implement the calculations shown by the table headers: (a) Total Marks under EXAMINATIONS = 1st Unit Test + 2nd Unit Test; (b) X = 20% of UT Total Marks; (c) Y = 30% of Half Yearly marks; (d) Z = 50% of Annual Exam marks; (e) Total 100 Marks = X + Y + Z.

Include the same subject list as shown in the image as default rows: English, English II, Mathematics, Hindi, EVS, G.K., Social Studies/Science, Science, Assamese, Computer, Drawing, Conversation, Health & Physical Education; plus a 'Total' row and a 'Percentage' row.

Add editing for the lower-section inputs shown in the image: (a) 'Fields' table items (Work Experience, Regularity, Punctuality, Cleanliness, Indigenous Sports, School Programmes, Visual and Performing Art) with Half Yearly and Annual entries; (b) Attendance Records: Total Working Days and Present Days; (c) Result and Remarks text entries.

Add basic validation and inline feedback: marks should be within 0–100 for Half Yearly and Annual; Unit Test inputs should be non-negative and clearly labeled (if max is unknown, do not enforce an upper bound for UT inputs, but still prevent negatives).
Provide a Print-friendly view so the filled form can be printed from the browser while keeping the output format closely matching the image (table borders, spacing, and headings retained).

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme that matches a paper report-card aesthetic (e.g., warm off-white background, dark gray/black text, subtle border lines), and enforce it consistently across the page.
Use a generated clean background form image (matching the provided layout) as a static asset and render inputs/values aligned on top of it so the on-screen output closely resembles the image.
Add an in-app data export feature that downloads the currently filled report-card data (scholastic marks, co-scholastic fields, attendance, result, remarks) as a single JSON file from the browser.
Add an in-app data import feature that allows the user to select a previously exported JSON file and restore the entire report-card state into the form.
Add a reset/clear action that restores the app to its default initial state (default subject list/rows, default co-scholastic fields, and empty attendance/result/remarks).
Add editable header fields for School Name and Student Name to the report card screen, and display them in a print-friendly way consistent with the paper report-card layout.
Persist School Name and Student Name in the app state and include them in Export JSON, Import JSON restore, and Reset behavior (reset clears them to empty).
Make the Subject name cells in the scholastic table editable so users can change subject titles directly in the table.

Make the School Name area appear as a fixed (sticky) header at the top of the report card layout so it stays at the top while the user scrolls the page, without overlapping the rest of the content. Ensure the fixed behavior is disabled for print so the printed output remains laid out normally.

Display the school name as a bold, centered line above the “ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE” heading, using the exact text “VARDHMAN PUBLIC SCHOOL”. The on-screen and printed versions must both show this school name above the Academic Performance section.
Update print formatting so the browser print output is A4 paper in Landscape orientation, and ensure the report-card layout fits within the printable area without being clipped.

Remove the duplicate editable "School Name" field/column from the report card UI so that School Name is not shown twice. Keep the existing bold centered header text "VARDHMAN PUBLIC SCHOOL" above the “ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE” heading in both on-screen and print views.

Add two new editable header fields to the report card layout: "Class" and "Roll No". These fields must render as inputs on screen and as plain text placeholders/values in print (similar behavior to the existing Student Name print behavior).
Persist "Class" and "Roll No" in the app state and include them in JSON export/import/reset flows. Import must be backward-compatible with older JSON files that do not contain these fields.

Update the print layout so the entire report card prints on a single A4 page in landscape orientation without clipping or spilling onto a second page (fit-to-one-page behavior), while preserving the existing visual layout and table structure.

Adjust print-specific typography and spacing so the entire report card reliably fits on a single A4 landscape page by making fonts smaller (and tightening vertical spacing where needed) without changing the table structure or calculations.
